parameters.description:
Setting to application/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended

See preview notices.
parameters.name: accept

parameters.description: Required. The name of the repository.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: A short description of the repository.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: A URL with more information about the repository.
parameters.name: homepage

parameters.description: Either true to create a private repository or false to create a public one.
parameters.name: private

parameters.description:
Can be public or private. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, visibility can also be internal. For more information, see "Creating an internal repository".
The visibility parameter overrides the private parameter when you use both parameters with the nebula-preview preview header.
parameters.name: visibility

parameters.description:
Either true to enable issues for this repository or false to disable them.

Default: true
parameters.name: has_issues

parameters.description:
Either true to enable projects for this repository or false to disable them. Note: If you're creating a repository in an organization that has disabled repository projects, the default is false, and if you pass true, the API returns an error.

Default: true
parameters.name: has_projects

parameters.description:
Either true to enable the wiki for this repository or false to disable it.

Default: true
parameters.name: has_wiki

parameters.description: Either true to make this repo available as a template repository or false to prevent it.
parameters.name: is_template

parameters.description: The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repository in an organization.
parameters.name: team_id

parameters.description: Pass true to create an initial commit with empty README.
parameters.name: auto_init

parameters.description: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "Haskell".
parameters.name: gitignore_template

parameters.description: Choose an open source license template that best suits your needs, and then use the license keyword as the license_template string. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".
parameters.name: license_template

parameters.description:
Either true to allow squash-merging pull requests, or false to prevent squash-merging.

Default: true
parameters.name: allow_squash_merge

parameters.description:
Either true to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or false to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits.

Default: true
parameters.name: allow_merge_commit

parameters.description:
Either true to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or false to prevent rebase-merging.

Default: true
parameters.name: allow_rebase_merge

parameters.description: Either true to allow automatically deleting head branches when pull requests are merged, or false to prevent automatic deletion.
parameters.name: delete_branch_on_merge

parameters.description: Allows deletion of the protected branch by anyone with write access to the repository. Set to false to prevent deletion of the protected branch. Default: false. For more information, see "Enabling force pushes to a protected branch".

parameters.description:
Filter collaborators returned by their affiliation. Can be one of:
* outside: All outside collaborators of an organization-owned repository.
* direct: All collaborators with permissions to an organization-owned repository, regardless of organization membership status.
* all: All collaborators the authenticated user can see.

title: Check if a user is a repository collaborator

parameters.description:
The permission to grant the collaborator. Only valid on organization-owned repositories. Can be one of:
* pull - can pull, but not push to or administer this repository.
* push - can pull and push, but not administer this repository.
* admin - can pull, push and administer this repository.
* maintain - Recommended for project managers who need to manage the repository without access to sensitive or destructive actions.
* triage - Recommended for contributors who need to proactively manage issues and pull requests without write access.

Default: push
parameters.name: permission

parameters.description:
Setting to application/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended

See preview notice.
parameters.name: accept

parameters.description: Required. The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or SHA.
parameters.name: ref

parameters.description:
Specifies a task to execute (e.g., deploy or deploy:migrations).

Default: deploy
parameters.name: task

parameters.description:
Attempts to automatically merge the default branch into the requested ref, if it's behind the default branch.

Default: true
parameters.name: auto_merge

parameters.description: The status contexts to verify against commit status checks. If you omit this parameter, GitHub verifies all unique contexts before creating a deployment. To bypass checking entirely, pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts.
parameters.name: required_contexts

parameters.description: JSON payload with extra information about the deployment.
parameters.name: payload

parameters.description:
Name for the target deployment environment (e.g., production, staging, qa).

Default: production
parameters.name: environment

parameters.description: Short description of the deployment.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Specifies if the given environment is specific to the deployment and will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: falseNote: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type. Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type.
parameters.name: transient_environment

parameters.description: Specifies if the given environment is one that end-users directly interact with. Default: true when environment is production and false otherwise. Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type.
parameters.name: production_environment

parameters.description: Required. The state of the status. Can be one of error, failure, inactive, in_progress, queued pending, or success. Note: To use the inactive state, you must provide the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type. To use the in_progress and queued states, you must provide the application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json custom media type. When you set a transient deployment to inactive, the deployment will be shown as destroyed in GitHub.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. Note: It's recommended to use the log_url parameter, which replaces target_url.
parameters.name: target_url

parameters.description:
The full URL of the deployment's output. This parameter replaces target_url. We will continue to accept target_url to support legacy uses, but we recommend replacing target_url with log_url. Setting log_url will automatically set target_url to the same value. Default: ""
Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type. Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type.
parameters.name: log_url

parameters.description: A short description of the status. The maximum description length is 140 characters.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Name for the target deployment environment, which can be changed when setting a deploy status. For example, production, staging, or qa. Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json custom media type.
parameters.name: environment

parameters.description:
Sets the URL for accessing your environment. Default: ""
Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type. Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type.
parameters.name: environment_url

parameters.description:
Adds a new inactive status to all prior non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and environment name as the created status's deployment. An inactive status is only added to deployments that had a success state. Default: true
Note: To add an inactive status to production environments, you must use the application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json custom media type.
Note: This parameter requires you to use the application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json custom media type.
